image.altText: nsw police badges

props.synopsis: A 28-year-old police officer has been charged with multiple alleged domestic violence-related offences following an investigation that began last year, NSW Police has confirmed.

title.children: NSW police officer charged with multiple alleged domestic violence offences

image.altText: Several police detectives stand outside a house.

props.synopsis: An unauthorised website claimed to have published online the personal details of many customers, with a threat to publish those of more than 1 million customers in the reported leak.

title.children: Sydney man facing blackmail charges after being arrested over alleged NSW clubs data breach

image.altText: QandAThumb

props.synopsis: Criminologist and former NSW Police detective Vincent Hurley, who went viral lecturing politicians on Q+A, says there are immediate solutions to keep women and children safe.

title.children: 'I don't think it's that hard': The former cop who says he knows how to save more domestic violence victims

image.altText: Two adults holding the hand of a young child

props.synopsis: The sexual assault of a 12-year-old child, cockroach infestations and a lack of access to showers and healthy food have been identified in a report into the emergency accommodation for vulnerable children in New South Wales.

title.children: 'Moving cage to cage': Report reveals 'heartbreaking' conditions facing children in emergency care in NSW

image.altText: the exterior of a white apartment building

props.synopsis: The NSW government has announced an inquiry into one of the country's largest strata management firms following revelations on ABC's 730 that it was charging exorbitant insurance fees and taking an untold sum in industry kickbacks.

title.children: NSW government announces inquiry into strata management firm following ABC investigation

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks with a woman at a rally against gendered violence

props.synopsis: The unspoken undercurrent of the week is that it's clear there are a lot of men feeling uncomfortable about this conversation. That doesn't make them bad men. It should be uncomfortable.

title.children: 'BE BETTER MY DUDES': Why lots of men are feeling uncomfortable about the domestic violence conversation

image.altText: Unidentified male using laptop in dark environment.

props.synopsis: A new survey finds online predators are targeting parents who share photos of their children on social media, asking them sexual questions and offering them cash for more photos.

title.children: Parents warned predators are seeking photos of their kids online

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Adelaide businessman Solomon Farah is accused of indecently assaulting a dozen women during job interviews, with a prosecutor telling an Adelaide court there may be more than 70 victims in total.

title.children: Businessman allegedly indecently assaulted 12 women during job interviews

image.altText: Young girl and mother smiling at camera

props.synopsis: Single mother Jennifer Hinton spent months saving for a trip from Mackay to Melbourne with her daughter, but now it's looking unlikely that she will get a refund any time soon.

title.children: No refunds in sight for hundreds of families caught up in Bonza collapse

image.altText: An older woman with red hair wearing all black walks alongside a barrister, carrying paperwork, outside a busy courtroom.

props.synopsis: Pauline Hanson's counsel tells the Federal Court that the One Nation leader was speaking rhetorically in her tweet to Greens deputy leader Mehreen Faruqi. Senator Faruqi is suing Senator Hanson under racial discrimination laws.

title.children: 'Not a nice tweet' but Hanson was speaking rhetorically in telling senator to go 'back to Pakistan', court hears

image.altText: People protest outside state parliament.

props.synopsis: For 171 years Adelaide's Crown and Anchor has stood as a site of history and music. Now the battle is on to save the venue from big developers.

title.children: An international developer versus rock stars and politicians. This is the fight for an Adelaide icon

image.altText: Majib Alibadi, an alleged key figure in Melbourne's tobacco wars.

props.synopsis: An alleged key figure in Melbourne's tobacco wars enjoyed the high life before his arrest, police say, frequenting expensive restaurants and buying designer clothing.

title.children: Alleged key player in Melbourne tobacco wars led life of luxury, say police

image.altText: Travis Boak tackles Max Michalaney who has the football

props.synopsis: Adelaide and Port Adelaide meet for the 55th edition of the Showdown as one of the AFL's most heated rivalries takes centre stage in Thursday night footy. Follow live.

title.children: Crows threatening huge Showdown upset with Port on the ropes in the last quarter

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Connor Rozee has been subbed out with an injury
3QT: Adelaide 23 points up at the last change in the Showdown
HT: Crows stretch their lead to 19 points over Power

image.altText: Isaah Yeo and the Panthers wrestle with Cameron Murray of South Sydney in a tackle.

props.synopsis: Things go from bad to worse for the last-placed South Sydney Rabbitohs, who lose halfback Dean Hawkins and young fullback Jye Gray to injury in a 42-12 drubbing at the hands of Penrith. Follow live.

title.children: Three players sent to the sin-bin as Panthers run over the top of woeful, injury-hit Rabbitohs

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 68' We have a third sin-binning for the night!
The Panthers embarrass South Sydney after a horribly lazy effort

image.altText: Police vehicle in a beach carpark with officers in the background

props.synopsis: A man in his 20s has died following a stabbing near the popular Park Beach on the NSW Mid North Coast this morning.

title.children: Surfer dies after stabbing at Coffs Harbour beach

image.altText: Canterbury Bulldogs general manager Phil Gould talking and gesturing in a screengrab from Channel Nine's 100% Footy program.

props.synopsis: Canterbury football boss Phil Gould cops a $20,000 fine, half of which will be suspended for two years, for making "public comments detrimental to the game" on Channel Nine.

title.children: 'What sort of stupid game is this?': Phil Gould hit with hefty fine by NRL for rant on Channel Nine

image.altText: Woman in shadow walking down a tunnel.

props.synopsis: More than half of those who have previously applied for the payment have either been declined or failed to complete the process.

title.children: Government knocks back expanding escaping violence payment despite sector calls

image.altText: A composite images of the headshots of Carr and Peters.

props.synopsis: Bob Carr says he intends to sue New Zealand Deputy Prime Minister Winston Peters over controversial remarks made on radio this morning after weeks of debate about AUKUS.

title.children: 'He's embarrassed the country': NZ's foreign minister slammed for on air-comments about Bob Carr

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Domestic violence advocates and legal experts are calling for changes to bail laws to protect women following the death of Molly Ticehurst, whose funeral was held today.

title.children: A specific change to NSW bail laws 'could save lives', domestic violence advocates and legal experts say

image.altText: Three memorial crosses in the ground with a rainbow in the distance.

props.synopsis: Jailed child killer Robert Farquharson is preparing to launch a fresh appeal against his conviction. He is currently serving a life sentence for the murder of his three young sons nearly two decades ago.

title.children: Robert Farquharson drove his sons into a lake and killed them. 19 years later he is set to appeal his life sentence

image.altText: A woman and man both leaving court separately with their faces blurred.

props.synopsis: A victim of a former husband and wife who had sex with underage employees who worked at their family-owned bakery in regional South Australia in the 1980s has spoken of her "soul-destroying" suffering, saying her abusers "destroyed my adolescence".

title.children: Victim of 'soul-destroying' sexual abuse tells former bakery couple 'you're both monsters'

image.altText: Pro-Palestinian protesters on one side of a body of water and pro-Isreal on the other.

props.synopsis: A university-based pro-Palestinian protest movement that has made headlines in the United States is being mirrored in Australia.

title.children: Uni protest movement that has made headlines in the US now being mirrored in Australia

image.altText: Graphic of Bruce Lehrmann and Lisa Wilkinson with question marks in the background

props.synopsis: Justice Michael Lee reserved his decision on costs in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case against Network Ten and Lisa Wilkinson, but has ruled on some issues.

title.children: The latest Bruce Lehrmann defamation case hearing provided some answers, but key questions remain

image.altText: Jake and Callum Robinson smiling on a beach

props.synopsis: Two Perth brothers are missing on a surf trip in Mexico, with WA's premier describing their disappearance as "distressing".

title.children: Perth brothers disappear during Mexico surfing trip, with loved ones issuing desperate plea for help

image.altText: Anonymous people sit inside an Audi car.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating a crash that killed a former police officer and a 24-year-old woman in a Brisbane tunnel on Wednesday afternoon.

title.children: Former police officer killed in Brisbane tunnel crash

image.altText: Seoul Searching

props.synopsis: South Korea once "sold off" babies to international families. Now adoptees are coming home and looking for answers.

title.children: Mary's adoptive parents thought they were rescuing an orphan. Like thousands, they were lied to

image.altText: A woman stands in her living room

props.synopsis: An expert panel on literacy and numeracy has made eight recommendations to the ACT government to improve the education system.

title.children: Stephanie's son wasn't taught to read properly. She's hopeful changes to the ACT education system will help others

image.altText: Nickelodeon producer Dan Schneider on stage with an award surrounded by people

props.synopsis: Former Nickelodeon producer Dan Schneider says he's suing the producers behind the docuseries Quiet on Set, which accused him of inappropriate behaviour on his TV shows.

title.children: 'It was a hit job': Nickelodeon show creator Dan Schneider sues Quiet on Set producers for defamation

image.altText: A man in a suit rests his hand on his chest, standing in front of Solomon Island and China flags.

props.synopsis: Former foreign minister and diplomat Jeremiah Manele has been elected as the new prime minister of Solomon Islands — and he's expected to maintain close ties with China.

title.children: Solomon Islands has a new PM — and some say he will 'lower the temperature'

image.altText: A man hugs a small alligator to his chest

props.synopsis: Wally's owner Joie Henney says his pet went missing while on vacation and he fears the reptile had been stolen by pranksters, then set free in the wild.

title.children: Wally the emotional support alligator is missing, suspected stolen and set free in the wild

image.altText: A calico cat standing up with its tail raised.

props.synopsis: Galena found herself at the centre of a stressful trip in an Amazon package, a feverish search, a California rescue and a tearful reunion.

title.children: Housecat who enjoys exploring cardboard boxes accidentally posted 860km in Amazon order return
